page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: WE START TODAY WITH CROPS. THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT CROPS. AS BARLEY,WHEAT, GRASS, TURNIPS AND SWEDES THERES LOTS OF FARMERS HAVE BARLEY. THEY PLANT IT MID APRIL AND HARVEST IT IN SEPTEMBER. THE AVERAGE IS 2_3 TONS TO AN ACRE. WHEAT IS A CROP WHICH IS PLANTED IN NOVEMBER AND IS HARVESTED IN OCTOBER. THE AVERAGE IS 3_5 TONS TO AN ACRE.WITH GRASS YOU GET GRAZING FOR ANIMALS. IF YOU MANURE IT YOU CAN GET HAY OR SILAGE.WITH MANURE GRASS GROWS FASTER.TURNIPS AND SWEDES ARE SOWN IN MAY AND ARE FOOD FOR ANIMALS IN WINTER OTHER CROPS AS OATS, CORN, POTATOES AND OIL SEED RAPE.THERE ARE DIFFERENT KINDS OF ANIMALS AS HORSES, COWS, SHEEP,DOGS, CATS AND RATS.THESE ALL STAY ON A FARM. THERE IS TRACTORS CALLED FORD, JOHNDEERE ,FIAT, MARSHALL AND CASE INTERNATIONAL.
